text: If (e.g.) I made statements about blacks being slaves on the "Democratic planation" & you accused me of racism, & the hostile comments I got included anti-Semitic slurs & you denounced the anti-Semitic slurs, I think it would be absurd to accuse you of fomenting anti-Semitism.
author: CathyYoung63

text: Of course it's relevant to the argument, even aside from the fact that it's extremely unlikely people who create such posters are inspired by something as anodyne and non-Muslim-bashing as Chelsea Clinton's remark.
author: CathyYoung63

text: Didn't Chelsea Clinton condemn that as well?
author: CathyYoung63

text: I mean, if someone were to say that attacking Trump for the "Mexican rapists" remark drives people into the arms of white nationalism, I would totally agree that that's insane.
author: CathyYoung63

text: But Chelsea was not engaging in anti-Islam rhetoric. Claiming that her extremely mild, not-at-all anti-Muslim comments about Omar enable anti-Muslim bigotry is like claiming (as I said before) that any criticism of racism or sexism enables "SJW extremism."
author: CathyYoung63

text: The argument that "SJW" extremism pushes some toward white nationalism can be compared to the argument that anti-Islam rhetoric pushes some people toward anti-Muslim violence. I have no problem with either of these points.
author: CathyYoung63

text: In other words, Chelsea is accused of energizing bad people on "her side" (at least vis a vis Omar) while the PC left is accused of pushing people toward bad things on the *other* side. But even disregarding that difference, the key distinction IMO is the nature of speech.
author: CathyYoung63

text: I don't think they're similar at all, esp since charge vs Chelsea is that she aided bigotry by supposedly condoning it while charge vs "PC left" is that it breeds bigotry by turning "anti-bigotry" to ugly extremes that alienate (sniffing out offenses, bashing whites/males, etc.)
author: CathyYoung63

text: Not really. The Chelsea blaming would be more like arguing that any condemnation of racism or sexism (not just the overreach) fuels white nationalism.
author: CathyYoung63

text: Condemning anti-Semitism when it comes from a Muslim -- without in any way attacking Muslims as a group -- enables bigotry? I do think that's insane, yeah. Especially when overt Muslim-bashing is so common.
author: CathyYoung63

text: Why is it crazy? Obviously hardcore white supremacists aren't just reacting to "PC." But is it that weird to think some people (esp the young) who are put off by "SJW" excesses go in search of anti-PC critiques online & get sucked into the far right fringe?
author: CathyYoung63

text: Amazing performance of St John's Passion (semi-staged) at @BerlinPhil tonight. Standing ovation afterward. Sir Simon Rattle, Magdalena Kozena, Mark Padmore, Peter Sellars
author: CathyYoung63

text: You're either a troll or an idiot. I grew up in Moscow in the 1970s. There were constant shortages of one or another kind of food, plus long lines. People from other towns took the train to Moscow to buy food because they had empty store shelves.
author: CathyYoung63

text:
I've always thought derogatory nicknames were the lowest, dumbest form of political insult. 

A conservative guy, on some forum where I posted way back, for some reason thought it was hilarious to refer to Al Gore as "Algore." I never did get the point of that...
author: CathyYoung63

text: New from me at @NewsdayOpinion: You can oppose "outrage mobs" without condoning #TuckerCarlson
author: CathyYoung63

text: Request to @NewsdayOpinion . Can you tweet my column today so I can RT?  I'm in Germany and can't access.
